description:
Deal and Spend Governance Advisors are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports -- and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, advocate best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.

The Google Ads Risk Management & Compliance Team helps Google to manage commercial deal and spend governance and the diverse universe of risks associated with these commitments. You will manage deal and spend review committee reviews of important, high-value commitments, work closely with partners and leadership across Google Sales, Product, Finance, Legal, and Marketing teams; you will also ensure that Google's deal and spend governance policies and processes are effective, efficient, and accountable and that Google is managing risk smartly across the business.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Project management experience, including working with cross-functional teams
  • Experience engaging with and crafting communications for executives.
  • Management or strategy consulting, or similar multi-disciplinary experience in a business capacity

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA, JD, or other advanced degree
  • Internal finance tool experience (combination of contract management, order management, invoicing, accounting, procurement, or payment systems)
  • SQL and/or AppScript coding experience
  • Experience implementing projects, managing programs, designing and implementing processes/controls
  • Familiarity/background in contracting system implementations. Excellent ability to lead, motivate others, set objectives, lead by influence, and drive to results.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead cross-functional spend review forums for significant expenditures for Google's real estate and technical infrastructure commitments; define, implement, and maintain processes and procedures to support sound spend governance by working closely with business partners in Finance, Legal, Product Management, Marketing, Technical Infrastructure, and Real Estate & Workplace Services
  • Influence executives and stakeholders to close gaps in control frameworks and develop scalable solutions
  • Identify, create, and measure process and control improvements that automate manual steps, consolidate bespoke processes, and scale with Google’s rapid growth
  • Draft, vet, and build cross-functional support for new policies and training of teams engaged in negotiating commitments on behalf of the company
  • Use data (and knack for the creative) to architect metrics, solve problems, and enhance executive decision making
title: Deal and Spend Governance Advisor
